main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Trenton, N.J. in the 1950s, including an incident involving a small, white unidentified speck on the moon in 1958, and a sighting of a 20-30 feet diameter circular object emitting a yellowish-white glow hovering at an altitude of 1,000 to 1,500 feet.
interesting points: The investigation of a photo from May 29, 1958, concluded that the object seen was likely a spot caused by photographic emulsion.

A witness, a civilian employee of the United States Air Force, reported observing a circular UFO emitting a yellowish-white glow, which remained stationary for several minutes before accelerating rapidly and disappearing from view.
A glossy 8x10 photograph showing an unidentified white speck on the moon in 1958 was considered unclassified.

A witness described an object approximately 20 to 25 feet in diameter and about 15 to 20 feet thick, moving at a slow speed and seemingly under intelligent control, before shooting off at a very high speed to the northeast.

A report in 1958 from the U.S. Air Force Technical Intelligence Center stated that an examination of subject photographs revealed many similar spots, and that the source who submitted the photograph was unemployed.
sighted object: various unidentified flying objects, including circular and oval-shaped objects
witnesses: civilian employees of the United States Air Force, a professional photographer, an expert photographer doing research for Princeton University, a witness in their backyard
